title: China, Iran's main economic backer, remains a bystander to the Middle East conflict
subhead: As Chinese diplomacy becomes increasingly active in the Middle East, Beijing – which buys 90% of Iran's exported oil – has continued to leave the role of regional policing to the US.

title: Beloved black Corsican beaches threatened by nickel mining project
subhead: Nickel, essential for the electric battery sector, is present in the sand of the artificial beaches of Nonza and Albo, in northern Corsica. A recent mining project has sparked widespread opposition from local residents, who are deeply attached to these beaches, shaped by the region's industrial past.

title: Was the Trump phenomenon a historical accident? Reinterpreting the history of the American right
subhead: Convinced that political liberalism was deeply rooted in the US, American historians long downplayed the far right's influence within the conservative movement. In light of new historiography, Trump appears less a historical accident and more the result of a long gestation.

title: Artificial intelligence consumes massive amounts of energy. Here's why
subhead: From developing models to their everyday use, generative AI has proven to be extremely energy-hungry. Le Monde breaks down the reasons behind this voracious demand, as their user base continues to expand.
